name: Country Music Ho-Down Multiple Choice Quiz | Country Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the profession of Tim McGraw's Father?
questions.explanation:
Professional Baseball Player.

	His father was Tug McGraw who played for the New York Mets.

questions.text: What Artist has had the most Top 40 Country Hits?
questions.explanation:
George Jones.

	George Jones has had 142 Top 40 hit and still adding to that number.

questions.text: Which of the following has NEVER had a Top 40 Country Hit?
questions.explanation:
Tom Petty.

	Tom Petty has written a couple of Country hit but has never hit the charts as a artist. Bob Seger hit with Shame on the Moon, Eric Clapton hit with Lay Down Sally, Lionel Richie hit with Stuck on you and Deep River Woman (with Alabama).

questions.text: What song was Reba McEntire singing when she was discovered?
questions.explanation:
The National Anthem.

	She was discovered singing the National Anthem at a Rodeo in Oklahoma by Red Steagall.

questions.text: Who is Known as 'The King of Western Swing'?
options: Ray Benson of Asleep at the Wheel
questions.explanation:
Bob Wills.

	If you are interested in Western Swing, you need to get the 2 tribute album by Asleep at the Wheel honoring Bob Wills.

questions.text: What artist was shot 4 times in an attempted robbery in Nashville in 1991?
What Rock Band was Vince Gill asked to join?
questions.explanation:
Dire Straits.

	Mark Knopfler asked Vince to join the band to play guitar but Vince declined because he wanted to give his solo career a chance to take off.

questions.text: What Song features the line 'The World must be flat, cause when people leave town they never come back'?
questions.explanation:
Small Town Saturday Night.

	Small Town Saturday Night by Hal Ketchum.

questions.text: What song is said to be 'The Perfect Country Western Song' in it's lyrics?
questions.correct: You Never Even Call Me by my Name
options: I Think I'll just stay here and drink
questions.explanation:
You Never Even Call Me by my Name.

	By David Allen Coe.

questions.text: What was Dolly Parton's First Top 40 Country Hit?
questions.explanation:
Dumb Blonde.

	And after 89 more hits, nobody is calling her a dumb blonde anymore.
